IKineTargetedObj Interface Reference
[KINE+ Module]

import "kineplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IKineTargetedObj:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

KINE+ target directed object.

This interface defines a pair of objects: the actual object and a target toward which it is oriented. Usually implemented together with IKineNode and IKineObj3D, so the objects are easily inserted into kinematical structures, the functionality defined in this interface offers a different metaphore for 3D orientation, using notions as the position, target and direction, where position + direction = target.

This interface is used by some scene objects like lights and cameras, see ISceneLightDir, ISceneLightSpot, ISceneCamera and their implementations in FreeWillPlus::SceneLightDir, FreeWillPlus::SceneLightSpot and FreeWillPlus::SceneCamera.

Kinematical Configuration
These function define how both object and its target are placed

HRESULT PutConfig (enum KINE_TARGET mode, IKineNode *pRemoteTarget)
 Sets the kinematic configuration to one of KINE_TARGET modes; pRemoteTarget used only with KINE_TARGET_REMOTE mode.

HRESULT GetConfig ([out] enum KINE_TARGET *pMode,[out] IKineNode **pRemoteTarget)
 Gets the configuration setting; notice that *pRemoteTarget will be set NULL unless mode is KINE_TARGET_REMOTE.

HRESULT GetPairedNode ([out, retval] IKineNode **)
 Gets the paired node, look here for details.

HRESULT PutTiltWithTarget (BOOL)
 Binds the Up Vector with Target (TRUE) or Object (FALSE, default).

HRESULT GetTiltWithTarget ()
 Retuens S_OK if the Up Vector is bound with the Target or S_FALSE if it is bound with the object (default).

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IKineTargetedObj::GetPairedNode (  [out, retval] IKineNode **   ) 
 

Gets the paired node, look here for details.

The result of this function depends on the current KINE_TARGET mode (see PutConfig):

  • KINE_TARGET_INCENTER: returns automatically created orbiting object node
  • KINE_TARGET_ORBITING: returns automatically created orbiting target node
  • KINE_TARGET_PEER: returns automatically created peer target node
  • KINE_TARGET_REMOTE: returns the target set by the user in PutConfig (the same is returned by GetConfig)
